venue.name: NU Cafe - Somerville
venue.description:
NU Café & Juice Bar is the work of founder and CEO Joshua Van Dyke, who has spent the last year preparing the space at 195 Washington St., in the base of a new condo development, as previously reported. The cafe will seat 60 people, with 12 counter seats along the window, and it will accommodate everything from casual dining to meet-ups. Customers will be able to get meals to go and can place orders online to pick up in the cafe.

The eatery prides itself on sourcing local ingredients and all-natural meats for its menu, putting its own spin on cafe fare. NU Café’s menu spans breakfast, lunch, and dinner, with items like sweet potato quinoa muffins, breakfast sandwiches, salad and grain bowls, wraps, soups, and even a selection of local craft beers and wine.

painting.title: Herb Garden in Chalkboard Planter

venue.name: Aloft
venue.description:
Looking for a fun event in Boston’s hottest new neighborhood? Check out the vibrant Re:mix Lounge at the Aloft Hotel in the Seaport District where artists, locals, and travelers can all mix and mingle.

Whether you’re heading to a Paint Nite event for girls night out on the town or to meet other artistic individuals, you can connect in the lounge over cocktails and listen to live music.

Arrive early to grab a signature cocktail or bite to eat from the WXYZ® bar, play a game of pool, or just to hang out in front of the fireplace and listen to some live music.

Don’t forget to get social and share your moments with us!

INSTAGRAM / FACEBOOK / TWITTER

painting.title: Succulent Terrarium in Rose Bowl

venue.name: Elephant & Castle Pub and Restaurant
venue.description:
The Elephant and Castle Pub is one of those places that really captures the spirit and history of Boston.

 

Located just steps from Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, the Old South Meeting House, and the Old State House Museum, the Elephant and Castle stands on the very spot where the flow of molasses from the Great Molasses Flood finally came to an end on January 15, 1919. The menu features heart-warming comfort foods from Britain, such as bangers and mash, fish & chips, shepherd's pie, roast beef and Yorkshire pudding, as well as American fare such as grilled fish, chicken, pasta, and a wide variety of sandwiches. The Elephant and Castle also serves one of the best breakfasts in Boston-a great way to start your day exploring the city.


Plant Nite is growing all over Boston - and it's growing into one of the top fun things to do with friends for a night out, all while drinking wine or cocktails! We partner with some of the best bars in the area, with events in Cambridge, Somerville, Medford, Quincy, and more! If we aren't in your neighborhood yet, ask your favorite spot to reach out to us. We'll take care of the rest! We're passionate about putting on events that are more party than gardening class, and we want to help you take home a DIY terrarium you can be proud of.

venue.name: Good Life (Financial District)
venue.description:
Good Life resides in the heart of downtown Boston and is a full restaurant and nightclub experience.

The Good Life is a popular after-work haunt for business men and women and a nighttime hotspot for club-goers, hipsters and overall music lovers.
Good Life has racked up numerous awards from local media including several honors from The Boston Phoenix and Weekly Dig proclaiming its 28 Kingston St. location the best dance venue in the city. With two floors, three bars, local artwork, live music and DJs from across the country spinning both upstairs and down, Good Life is a slice of something different in Downtown Crossing.

28 Kingston Street
Boston, MA 02111
(617) 451-2622


T stations- South Station and Downtown Crossing

artist.description: Plants are the closest thing that Mya has to pets. She started learning about them in earnest while working on organic farms. Her favorite vegetables are green beans and hakurei turnips. Mya is a graduate of Northwestern University (where she studied nothing related to plants) and works in environmental education.

venue.name: Tamo Restaurant Seaport Hotel
venue.description:
Located on the waterfront in the bustling Seaport District, TAMO Bistro & Bar, situated in the luxurious Seaport Boston Hotel, offers contemporary cuisine and features hand-crafted cocktails and stylishly presented food inspired by Boston’s famous ethnic neighborhoods, the bounty of New England farms and the adjacent Atlantic Ocean.  The adjacent TAMO Loft is the ideal venue for a private reception, lunch or dinner.

node.title: Brunch & Plant: Warehouse Grille & Bar (Patio) 07/23/2017
node.description:
Enjoy a delicious brunch item from a prix fixe menu plus a custom mimosa while planting your own terrarium on the outdoor patio at Warehouse Bar and Grill.

This brunch time Plant Nite event includes all supplies needed to create your terrarium, instructions from a local expert, plus a brunch item and 1 drink per person.

BRUNCH & PLANT MENU

CUSTOM MIMOSA 
Champagne served with choice of orange, mango or pomegranate juice 

ONE BRUNCH ITEM 

GRILLED AVOCADO TOAST
Strawberries, sea salt, evoo, balsamic reduction, multigrain toast

VEGGIE OMELETTE
Egg whites, seasonal vegetables, goat cheese, breakfast potatoes 

BRUNCH BURGER
Sirloin patty, fried egg, bacon, cheddar, maple sauce, breakfast potatoes

artist.description: Plants are the closest thing that Mya has to pets. She started learning about them in earnest while working on organic farms. Her favorite vegetables are green beans and hakurei turnips. Mya is a graduate of Northwestern University (where she studied nothing related to plants) and works in environmental education.

venue.name: Warehouse Bar & Grille (Financial District)
venue.description:
Warehouse Bar & Grille was born to be a whole new generation of the classic American pub, a lively restaurant and bar that offers the affordable, crave-able American food our guests want to eat. Guests are served by our friendly staff in a high-energy atmosphere, alongside an extensive list of craft beers, draft wine and signature cocktails.

We're the perfect place for friends, family and business patrons to meet for lunch, dinner, happy hour, game day, brunch, late night and community gatherings. Stop by today to see why people love to stay at the Warehouse!

Warehouse
40 Broad Street (At Milk)
Boston, MA 02109

Tel:  617.936.4383
www.thewarehouseboston.com

painting.title: Succulent Terrarium in 6.5" Glass Slope Bowl

artist.description:
Stephanie has been creating things her entire life. Whether it be a sculpture made from toilet paper rolls, or painting a set for a musical, she's always making something. A self-taught artist, Steph has a background in photography, painting, theater, music, and general wackiness. 

When not at Paint Nite or Plant Nite, she can be found in a classroom with kiddos teaching them how to be the next Meryl Streep, hanging out with her adorable animal crew, or belting her heart out (and I'm sure driving her neighbors crazy).

venue.name: Scholars
venue.description:
If you are coming with a group (yay, how fun!) make sure you arrive 30 minutes before to secure seats together. If you arrive early to eat first, please tell the host that you are attending the Plant Nite event. Head over to secure your seats, then enjoy your dinner!

*Please note, this planting party is only for adults age 21 and older and is NOT a BYOB event--all food and drink must be purchased at the restaurant. No food or drink is included with your ticket price.

When you’re in Boston looking to mix a little wine and painting together, check out Scholars!  

If you’re looking for a bachelorette party, birthday party, date night or girl's night out idea, a Plant Nite event at Scholars should certainly make it on your bucket list of things to do in Boston. Come a little early or stay a little late!

WEBSITE / FACEBOOK

venue.name: Central Wharf Co.
venue.description:
The most recent addition to the Glynn Hospitality Group portfolio, Central Wharf Co. located on Milk Street is the newest hot spot in the financial district. Whether you are coming for dinner or meeting friends for some of our hand crafted cocktails, Central Wharf’s welcoming atmosphere is reaffirmed by its gastronomic offerings. With a focus on healthy preparations and locally sourced ingredients, their simple comfort foods concepts are enhanced buy their contemporary accompaniments.

160 Milk Street, Boston, MA
Phone: (617) 451-9460
centralwharf@irishconnection.com
or info@irishconnection.com

Monday - Sunday

11:00am – 2:00am

Sunday Brunch

11:00am-2:00pm

painting.title: Distressed Wood Succulent Terrarium Rose Quartz Crystal

venue.name: Kirkland Tap & Trotter
venue.description:
The Kirkland Tap & Trotter showcases dishes that Chef Maws enjoys at home with friends and family. The beverage program features a large beer list, and an expansive wine by the glass list tilting toward Old World terroir and funky wines. Additionally, The Kirkland Tap & Trotter has partnered with Revolution Cocktails to create a unique cocktail menu with drinks that are well-crafted but “don’t take ten minutes to make.”

Tony Maws is the award-winning chef and owner behind the Northeast’s culinary gem: Craigie on Main. 2011 James Beard Award Winner for Best Chef Northeast, and a Food & Wine Best New Chef (2005), Maws is celebrated equally for his innovative and traditional work in the kitchen, and is known for his immense talent, creativity, and rugged standards and expectations for himself and his staff, as well as the farmers and suppliers who visit him daily. 

http://kirklandtapandtrotter.com/

painting.title: Succulent Terrarium in Light Wood Tapered Rectangle

venue.name: Basho Sushi (Fenway)
venue.description:
Basho is the first modern Japanese brasserie to hit Boston, serving the freshest and most high-quality ingredients and sushi (flown in daily from around the world). With a variety of seating options—from communal tables, a private dining “cocoon” and intimate corners to a sushi bar, raw bar and sleek, wraparound liquor bar—Basho pulses with the raw energy of the city from opening to close.

1338 Boylston Street
Boston, MA
617) 262-1338

We validate parking at 1330 Boylston St. Garage even during Red Sox games, entrance off of Jersey Street.

Please come join us for Happy Hour from 4:30pm-6pm with Late Night from 10pm-11:30pm daily.
bashosushi.com

venue.name: Brandy Pete's
venue.description:
Brandy Pete's, a longtime Landmark in Boston's Financial District, was established as a restaurant in 1933 (at the end of Prohibition) by Pete Sabia. It was located at 80 Broad Street, diagonally left of Franklin Street, and a two minute walk from its current location.

\\n\\n

A Brandy drinker, Peter was often seen talking with customers having a snifter in his hand. It became tradition that anyone who was new to Pete's, or complained about the food or service, etc. had to buy Pete a Brandy, hence the name "Brandy Pete's".

\\n\\n

It is the goal of the establishment to carry on the tradition of providing a friendly atmosphere featuring an honest drink, a wide-ranging, moderately priced menu, from salads and sandwiches to steaks and fine dining entrees in the evening, with fast and attentive service. We hope you enjoy your experience and will tell others about what is new at Pete's!

\\n\\n

Brandy Pete's
\\n267 Franklin St.
\\nBoston, Massachusetts 02110
\\n
\\nMetered Street Parking (free after 8pm) & lots of Garages nearby
\\n
\\nClosest T stops
\\nGreen Line: Park Street
\\nRed Line: Downtown Crossing
\\nBlue Line: State Street or Aquarium
\\n

venue.name: Two Three Zero (Union Square)
venue.description:
Two Three Zero is a modern styled event space located downstairs from Paint Nite HQ. Just steps away from trendy Union Square, Two Three Zero provides guests with comfortable lounge seating, a full service bar featuring a lite bites food menu, and ample room for you and your friends to sit back, relax and enjoy your event. Follow us on Facebook Twitter and Instagram to keep an eye on upcoming events. Questions about private rentals? Learn more at 23zero.com.


Parking is limited and can be tricky in the Union Square area (DO NOT park at Target! They tow, and that's no fun!) Click here or see below for a handy parking map:
